column1: '''From the many-willow'd margin of the immemorial Thames''' is a poem written by [[J.R.R. Tolkien]]. It was published in ''[[The Stapeldon Magazine|Stapeldon Magazine]]''
column3: No. 3 in December of [[1913]]. Tolkien signed the poem as "J.".

column1: <poem>From the many-willow'd margin of the immemorial Thames
Standing in a vale outcarven in a world-forgotten day
There is dimly seen uprising through the greenly veiled stems

column2: tower-crowned in its dreamy robe of grey

column1: All the city by the fording: aged in the lives of men
Proudly wrapt in mystic mem'ry overpassing human ken.''</poem>
